articles.title: Stock market hits all-time high as Dow closes above 50,000 - The Washington Post
articles.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average finished at a record 50,115.67 on Friday, rising more than 1,200 points for the day.

articles.title: How options on the BlackRock bitcoin ETF may have worsened crypto meltdown - CoinDesk
articles.description: Options trading on BlackRock's spot bitcoin ETF, IBIT, surged to a record 2.33 million contracts on Thursday as bitcoin crashed.

articles.title: Uber must pay $8.5 million in driver sexual assault case, jury says. Here’s what it could mean for thousands of similar cases - cnn.com
articles.description: A jury found that Uber must pay $8.5 million to a woman who said one of its drivers raped her. The decision could set the stage for payments to thousands of other passengers who filed similar claims against the rideshare company.

articles.title: Health Agency Refers Knockoff GLP-1 Provider Hims & Hers to Justice Department - The Wall Street Journal

articles.description: From the first AI-generated Big Game ad courtesy of Svedka to Anthropic's beef with OpenAI, here are the biggest ads from Super Bowl LX.

Jennifer Garner’s Once Upon a Farm Rises 17% After $198 Million IPO - bloomberg.com
articles.description: Once Upon a Farm PBC, the organic kids snacks maker co-founded by actress Jennifer Garner, jumped 17% in its trading debut Friday after the company and some of its investors raised $197.9 million in an initial public offering.

articles.title: Trump-GOP Law Slashes Amazon's Tax Bill by 87% as Company Fires 30,000 Workers, Profits Soar - Common Dreams
articles.description: "Congress made a choice: cut assistance for the most vulnerable to double down on a tax code already favoring dominant firms," said one progressive think tank.

articles.title: CFTC Staff Reissues Letter 25-40 Updating Payment Stablecoin Definition - Commodity Futures Trading Commission | CFTC (.gov)
articles.description: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission’s Market Participants Division today announced it has reissued CFTC Staff Letter 25-40 with a limited revision to the definition of “payment stablecoin.”

articles.title: Sen. Adam Schiff And Rep. Laura Friedman Call For Netflix And Paramount To Commit To Preserving Film And TV Jobs In A Warner Bros. Acquisition - Deadline
articles.description: Adam Schiff and Laura Friedman want the companies to commit to jobs as part of a Warner Bros. purchase.

articles.title: There isn’t even a cynical explanation for Jeff Bezos destroying The Washington Post - theverge.com
articles.description: Trying to explain what the Amazon founder gets out of owning the Washington Post during the Trump era.

articles.title: A New Gilded Age: Big Tech goes on a $600 billion AI spending splurge - Business Insider
articles.description: Big Tech's capital expenditures soar with Amazon, Google, Meta, and Microsoft at the forefront, ushering a new era of AI infrastructure spending.

articles.title: It Turns Out Waymos Are Being Controlled by Workers in the Philippines - Futurism
articles.description: During a Congressional hearing, Waymo's chief safety officer, Mauricio Peña, was grilled over the company's reliance on overseas workers.

articles.title: Stellantis to Take Charges of About €22 Billion on EV Reset - bloomberg.com
articles.description: Stellantis NV is taking more than €22 billion ($26 billion) in charges mainly linked to reversing course on its electric vehicle strategy, prompting a record plunge in the Jeep and Fiat owner’s shares.

articles.title: Historic Kentucky distillery Four Roses sold for up to $775M. What we know - Lexington Herald Leader
articles.description: Kirin will sell Four Roses to E&J Gallo for up to $775m, returning the Lawrenceburg, Kentucky distillery to U.S. ownership with no planned operational changes.

articles.title: NFL-Super Bowl Hangover? Record number of employees to miss work on Monday, poll suggests - Yahoo Finance
articles.description: By Frank Pingue SAN FRANCISCO, Feb 6 (Reuters) - The day after the Super Bowl has earned a notorious nickname among American workers: Super Sick Monday.
